instructor_mikael_description: Mikael's dance journey began unexpectedly during a trip to Cuba, where he originally went to train in boxing. There he discovered salsa – a dance full of energy, feeling, and community – and something clicked. It was the start of a passion that would shape the coming years of his life.

Since then, Mikael has been dancing for over 12 years with a focus on bachata, but also with experience in salsa, kizomba, and zouk. He has been teaching dance for about 7 years and is the founder of Fuego Dance School.

In addition to dance, Mikael has also instructed in Thai boxing for 9 years and has a background as a high school teacher. This combination has shaped his teaching style – clear, methodical, and inspiring – with a focus on technique, musicality, and safety in partner dancing.

Furthermore, he has trained in Bachata Sensual for over 1.5 years with Korke & Judith and has competed successfully in the Jack & Jill format. His driving force is to help every student grow and dare to express themselves through dance.
instructor_mikael_favoriteTeaching: Technique and musicality in Bachata Sensual.
instructor_irina_description: Irina started with ballroom and Latin dance at the age of five, while also practicing gymnastics mixed with ballet. Since then, dance has been a major part of her life.
Bachata became a great love after Irina took a trial lesson, and she has been teaching since 2017. In 2020, Irina and Mikael became a dance couple and now teach at Fuego Dance School.

For 1.5 years, Irina and Mikael have been part of a mentorship program with Korke and Judith, the founders of Bachata Sensual. Irina's teaching style is characterized by structure, technique, and pedagogy, which she has also gained from her daily work as a teacher.
instructor_irina_favoriteTeaching: Certified teacher, special education teacher, trained in dance technique
instructor_karin_description: Karin has been dancing bachata on and off for many years and also has experience in other
dance styles such as jazz, dancehall, salsa, and kizomba. She has been part of Fuego’s journey
since the very beginning and has known Mikael for several years, which makes Fuego feel like a

, second home to her.

For Karin, dance is about joy – it should be fun, and she wants people
to leave her class with a positive feeling in their body. She enjoys setting small,
concrete goals to develop both technically and mentally. This can be anything from

working on body control to building confidence on the dance floor.

Outside of dance,
Karin is a trained career and guidance counselor and is passionate about listening, coaching,
and supporting others in their growth – both in dance and in life.
instructor_tomas_description: Tomas Steifo was born and raised in Sweden. He discovered bachata in a rather unexpected way, after injuring his elbow during a martial arts competition. During his rehabilitation, he happened to see people dancing bachata outdoors. It immediately caught his interest, and he thought, 'Why not give it a try?' Since September 2021, he hasn't stopped dancing.

Over the years, Tomas has participated in many competitions, traveled, taught at festivals, and even served as a judge in dance competitions. Much of his inspiration comes from his background in MMA, especially the way techniques are broken down and taught there.

That mindset has strongly influenced how he teaches dance today. For Tomas, the best part is seeing his students develop and surprise themselves – that moment when something suddenly clicks for them is what means the most to him.
instructor_raminta_description: More information about Raminta coming soon.
instructor_jennifer_description: Jennifer discovered the SBK scene when she moved to Gothenburg in 2018, starting with salsa.
After attending a few socials, the door to bachata opened, and since then she has never looked back.
Besides bachata, Jennifer has been dancing since she was 6 years old, exploring everything from ballet and jazz to bugg, hip hop, and feminine vibe.
However, it was bachata that truly captured her heart.
“It is special to have found something where you can be so present in the moment that the outside world feels distant.”
As an instructor, Jennifer describes herself as strict but with a playful touch.
“Training and classes should be a mix of challenging, educational, and fun.
When you leave the class, you should feel uplifted and want more.”
instructor_sisco_description: Sisco stumbled into bachata with two left feet and fell head over heels. Eight years later, he is a certified instructor and a technique nerd with a sharp eye for detail in the dance.

With over 20 years of experience in the gym and fitness world, Sisco has a rock-solid understanding of how the body works and how to activate one's dance physique. He generously shares this knowledge with his students.

His greatest commitment is to his students' development, and he is meticulous in the best way. He loves to coach safe and confident dancers from the ground up, often using humor and his own invented metaphors.
Sisco both leads, follows, and role-rotates in bachata, which he believes is the smartest way to understand how the entire dance fits together.
instructor_nora_description: Nora is a warm and present instructor who blends meticulousness with playfulness.

She found bachata while living in Barcelona and often returns to gather more inspiration. In her classes, rhythm, technique, and humor all find a place in an inclusive environment. Through creativity and a participant-centered style, she aims to guide her students toward 'aha' moments.

With her background as a sexologist and extensive experience in social work, Nora has a strong focus on safety, interaction, and respect in dance. Since she dances both as a follower and a leader and rotates between roles, her focus is on ensuring students understand responsiveness, cooperation, and freedom of choice.
instructor_emma_description: Emma found her love for dance through salsa and also explored Zouk, Kizomba, and West Coast Swing. When she started with bachata as a student at Fuego Dance School at the end of 2022, she was instantly hooked. Since then, she has focused on refining her technique, flow, body control, and body awareness — always striving to grow as a dancer, instructor, and person. She became a help instructor in May 2024, and is now thrilled to teach Level 1.
For Emma, dance isn’t just about steps — it’s about connection, confidence, self-expression, and joy. She wants it to feel as natural and effortless as walking.
Her goal with the classes is to share that joy, encourage natural movement, and help you sharpen your technique — so you leave inspired to keep learning and evolving as a dancer.
She looks forward to continuing to develop together with her students — one step at a time.
instructor_andris_description: Andris tried out both salsa and bachata in July 2018 while in Latvia. But it wasn’t until March 2022 that his obsession with bachata really took off — while salsa stayed firmly in the past.

Since then, it's been a journey of blood, sweat, and tears, with countless returns to the basics. Along the way, he's also explored other solo dance styles, mainly hip-hop, to broaden his knowledge and keep growing.
But more than anything, Andris is all about the challenge. He loves pushing himself, learning new things, and seeing how far he can go.
No matter where you’re starting from, every dancer begins with a first step. Come and take it with us — there's space for you at Fuego.
